snippet: Trade negotiators fly hundreds of thousands of miles just doing their jobs, meaning that a cut of $5 million could effectively ground much of its 250-person work force.
abstract: Diplomatic Memo; Office of United States Trade Representatives has been waging battle for its budget, which shrank 7 percent to $47 million in 2013 because of sequestration spending caps; is concerned that cutting overseas travel budget of trade negotiators, who fly hundreds of thousands of miles to do their job, could effectively ground much of agency's 250-person work force and have large ripple effect on nation's global competitiveness.
lead_paragraph: Trade negotiators fly hundreds of thousands of miles just doing their jobs, meaning that a cut of $5 million could effectively ground much of its 250-person work force.

headline.main: After Congress’s Cuts, Envoys Say, U.S. Trade Suffers for Want of Jet Fare
headline.print_headline: After Congress’s Cuts, Envoys Say, U.S. Trade Suffers for Want of Jet Fare

keywords.value: Office of the United States Trade Representative
